intro: Laserpitium pseudosiler, commonly known as false siler, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, erect stem and finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It is native to Europe and parts of Asia, often found in grasslands and open woodlands. Laserpitium pseudosiler is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its delicate appearance.
